critique: The document primarily concerns the transfer of a government dock in Juneau, Alaska, from the Department of Interior to the Department of the Navy for Coast Guard use. It doesn't express explicit opinions on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores are neutral. The only exception is federalism, where the transfer from Interior to Navy (both federal entities) indicates a slight centralization of control.
